case.name: Brivis Australia Pty Ltd v Seeley International Pty Ltd [2008] FCA 87 (19 February 2008)

enforcement and remedies

mortgage over land

failure by lender to make reasonable inquiries as to borrower's capacity to meet interest payments
default on loan by borrower
proceeds of sale by mortgagee insufficient to meet borrower's obligation
liability of valuer for loss and damage suffered by lender
causal connection between contravention of trade practices act 1974 (cth) and loss and damage suffered

contract
formation of contract
exchange of correspondence, meetings and purchase orders with terms and conditions
assessment of actual terms of contracts
where respondents did not object to printed terms or put forward their own terms over a prolonged period the applicant's terms held to be incorporated into the contract contract

whether implied warranty goods existed that were of merchantable quality

duty of care
whether respondents breached duties to exercise reasonable care and skill in designing and manufacturing product

liability of both respondents in tort and contract
business sold by first respondent to second respondent without applicant's knowledge
second respondent continued to deal with applicant as before
both respondents in breach of express and implied terms of contract

respondent led evidence of lack of reliability in product
evidence disclosed general lack of brand awareness in product area
